s17cs350task1

Class Connector

  • java.lang.Object
    • s17cs350task1.Connector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Connector
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Defines a connector that belongs to a box. Use Box.connectChild(Connector) to attach it to the parent box, thereby making this one the child box. Offset units are arbitrary, but assumed to be the same as the size units in Box.

    A reasonable solution is about 13 lines of functional code. The suggested size of each method is in square brackets. A moderately larger solution is acceptable, as is a slightly smaller one; however, anything wildly outside this range is probably suspect.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Connector(Box childBox, javafx.geometry.Point2D offsetFromParentBox)
      Creates a connector that attaches to a box playing the role of the child box.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Connector clone()
      Returns a deep clone of this connector.
      Box getChildBox()
      Gets the child box to attach this connector to.
      javafx.geometry.Point2D getOffsetFromParentBox()
      Gets the signed distance from the center of the parent box to the center of the child box.
      Box getParentBox()
      Gets the parent box that this connector is attached to, if it is attached (check with hasParentBox()).
      boolean hasParentBox()
      Gets whether this connector is attached to a parent box.
      void setParentBox(Box parentBox)
      Sets the parent box to which this connector is attached.
      java.lang.String toString()
      This method is not required.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public Connector clone()
                throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        Returns a deep clone of this connector. In other words, it clones the child and ensures that the child clone is properly connected to its parent clone. The result should be a completely identical tree structure with completely identical objects that are not the original objects. [5]

        This must be a true deep clone. No instantiation is permitted for Box or Connector.

        This method uses at least the following other methods: Box.setConnectorToParent(s17cs350task1.Connector)

        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException - if clone is not supported; this cannot happen here, but Java still requires it to be declared
